what: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex

Reads bib chunks produce minimum viable bibtex equivalent separate title,URL field (applicable) rest data stored journal(internally) publisher(writing bibtex file)

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: install development version GitHub :

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: quick example use rebib package sample Rjournal article (included package inst/article)

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: procedure meant debugging errors finding went wrong.
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") file_name <- rebib::get_texfile_name(wd) bib_items <- rebib::extract_embeded_bib_items(wd,file_name) # for debugging single entry rebib::bibliography_parser(bib_items[1]) # for multiple entries rebib::bib_handler(bib_items[1:2])

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: Embedded bibliography : generated BibTeX :
code:
ibitem[R Core Team]{R} R Core Team 
ewblock R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing 
ewblock \emph{R Foundation for Statistical Computing}, Vienna, Austria \penalty0 2016. 
ewblock URL : \url{https://www.R-project.org/}, ISBN 3-900051-07-0 @book{R, author ={{ R Core Team }}, title ={{  R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing }}, publisher ={  R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria  2016., ISBN 3-900051-07-0 }, url = {https://www.R-project.org/} }

title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) #> [1] "No Bib files found !" #> [1] "will need to convert bbl to .bib" cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #> author ={{ Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert }}, #> title ={{  R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics }}, #> publisher ={  Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 3: 299--314, 1996.  }, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author ={{ R Core Team }}, #> title ={{  R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing }}, #> publisher ={  R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria  2016., ISBN 3-900051-07-0 }, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/} #> }

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) #> [1] "Found Bib file  example.bib" #> [1] "\\bibliography{bib_file} exists!" bib_path <- paste(wd, "example.bib", sep = "/") references <- rebib::split_bibtex_references(bib_path) print(references) #> $types #> [1] "book" "book" #>  #> $names #> [1] "ihaka:1996" "R"          #>
